result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Knigge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew R Knigge is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew R Knigge was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to Blood Draw Fee and DNA Surcharge - PAID IN FULL.  Balance of fine is to be paid at the rate of $50 per month commencing 06-01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 20 days jail with huber as penalty for failure to pay.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Oconomowoc Police Department.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

FIRST 100 DAYS TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME.
73 days sentence credit to be applied to the 100 days of Straigh Time.
Balance to be served with huber (all standard release conditions).
As of 02-15-2016, defendant is transferable to huber.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on 03-02-2016.  Defendant to serve 25 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Restitution is to be determined.
AMENDED 02-24-2016:  Court sets restitution at zero ($0).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R Knigge

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Estimate for Auto Repair.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Matthew R Knigge in court, in custody, with attorney Jess Martinez by Atty. Dan McMurray.   

Victim requests $6,590.08 in restitution.
Victim did not appear in court and was notified of today's hearing.

State is still requesting on behalf of the defendant the amount of $6,440.08.
Estimate for repair provided to the court.
Defense requests restitution be set at $0.00 based on the victim's non-appearance.

Court sets restitution at $0.00.
However, court would be willing to readdress if additional information is provided regarding if the repairs were actually done, and what amount did the insurance company cover.
Reasons placed on the record.
Amended JOC to be prepare.
Restitution hearing at 02-24-2016 10:30 am
Received and filed in court by the State.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Matthew R Knigge in court, in custody, with attorney Jess Martinez by atty. McMurray.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.
Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law.



Court orders the following:
200 Days in the Waukesha County.
First 100 days to be served Straight-Time.
73 Days Credit to be applied to the 100 Days of Straight-Time.
Balance to be served w/huber (all standard release conditions) As of February 15th the defendant is transferable to huber.

FINE: $ 1,179
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Oconomowoc Police Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid at the rate of $50 per month, Starting 06/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: 20 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Consecutive

30 Months D/L REVOCATION:
30 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK: 

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  03/02/16. 
Defendant to serve 25 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Restitution Requested by the victim:  $6,590.08
Defense objects and requests matter be scheduled for a restitution hearing.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-19-2016 10:30 am

Court modifies cash bail to:  $750.
Defendant has already posted $250 and need to post an additional $500.
CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program today after court.
Defendant is to report to WCS immediately upon release from custody.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Matthew R Knigge in court with attorney Jess Martinez by Atty. Dan McMurray.
Court to Address - Active Warrant - Non-Compliance with WCS.   

Defense presented statements to the court.

Court Quashes Warrant.
Bail is reinstated.

Court modifies cash bail to:  $750.
Defendant has already posted $250 and need to post an additional $500.
CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program today after court.
Defendant is to report to WCS immediately upon release from custody.

Any further non-compliance will result in the defendant remaining in custody pending resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Non-Compliance with W.C.S.
Branch 5 ONLY.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program today after court.

Defendant Matthew R Knigge in court with attorney Daniel McMurray.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses the non-compliance letter with the defendant. Defendant did not report with WCS because he thought he had to take care of the warrant first. Attorney McMurray is requesting that the $250.00 bail be reinstated and his client be allowed to report to WCS today. Court vacates the order to vacate bail and reinstates the bail. Defendant is ordered to go over to WCS right after court today.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing at 10-23-2015 11:30 am

Branch #5 ONLY if unable to post.

Attorney Jess Martinez by Atty. Dan McMurray in court.

Court orders a warrant be issued.
